"; } ?> Definition and Usage The usort() function sorts an array by values using a user-defined comparison function. Tip: Use the uksort() function to sort an array by keys using a user-defined comparison function. Tip: Use the uasort() function to sort an array by values (and maintain the index association) using a user-defined comparison function. Syntax usort( array, callback ) Parameter Values Parameter Description array Required. Specifies the array to sort callback Required. A comparison function. Must return an integer <, =, or > than 0 if the first argument is <, =, or > than the second argument Technical Details Return Value: Always returns TRUE PHP Version: 4+ PHP Changelog: PHP 8.2.0: Now returns TRUE ( PHP 8.0.0: If callback expects a parameter to be passed by reference, it will now return an E_WARNING ★ +1
